title: Brown Shooting and an M.I.T. Professor’s Killing: What We Know
summary: A single suspect carried out the shooting at Brown University and the killing of an M.I.T. professor, and was later found dead in New Hampshire, authorities said.

title: Trump’s Attacks on Rob Reiner and Others Characterize an Uninhibited 2nd Term
summary: Many of President Trump’s supporters love his professional-wrestling style of leadership. But some of his recent attacks have sickened even some of his own political allies.

title: Justice Dept. Won’t Meet Friday Deadline to Release All Epstein Files
summary: Several members of Congress criticized the department’s No. 2, Todd Blanche, after he said more documents would be coming weeks late.

title: Trump Administration to Appeal Harvard Funding Case
summary: Facing a deadline to appeal, the Justice Department told the courts late Thursday that it would try to overturn a judge’s ruling in favor of Harvard.

title: Europe Funnels Billions to Ukraine but Wobbles Geopolitically
summary: The European Union came up with an 11th-hour compromise to help Ukraine, but the solution raised questions about the bloc’s decisiveness.

title: With New E.U. Loan, Ukraine Avoids Budget Crunch and Can Plan War Effort
summary: The loan will cover two-thirds of the country’s financial needs for the next two years. It also bolsters Ukraine’s position in ongoing peace talks.

title: How the Army Caused Alarm in the Washington Skies Years Before a Fatal Crash
summary: An aged helicopter fleet and inexperienced pilots from nearby Fort Belvoir had raised “widespread concern” among local pilots before a midair collision killed 67 people.

title: Carrie Coon and Tracy Letts Want to Get Under Your Skin
summary: The couple are gearing up for the Broadway opening of “Bug,” about a descent into paranoia and psychosis in a squalid motel room.

title: Florida Executed A Record 19 People in 2025. He Witnessed Them All.
summary: John Koch, a radio reporter, witnesses every execution in Florida to keep close tabs on what he considers one of the most consequential actions the state takes.

title: The New School Seeks Path to Survival Amid Falling Enrollment and Money Woes
summary: The New York City university has embarked on an overhaul that some professors and students say imperils its standing as a bastion of the liberal arts.

title: NASA Webb Telescope Discovers Lemon-Shaped Planet, the ‘Stretchiest’ Ever Seen
summary: An unusual object orbiting a rapidly spinning star might be a new phenomenon in the universe.

title: U.S. Will Pay $450,000 to Wildfire Fighters With Cancer
summary: They will be eligible for a one-time payment as well as college tuition for their children. The effort is part of a legislative push to address the dangers of working in toxic smoke.

title: High Winds in Denver Prompt Warnings About Dangerous Fire Risk
summary: Thousands of people were without power in Colorado early Friday, and forecasters said some of the most extreme conditions were expected later in the day.

title: Australia Debates New Laws to Restrict Hate and Suspend Protests
summary: The authorities are vowing to crack down after a mass shooting at a Jewish holiday celebration. Experts say that what the country needs might not be new laws.

title: Australia Announces Plan to Buy Back Guns in Wake of Bondi Attack
summary: The program is expected to take hundreds of thousands of firearms out of circulation, the prime minister said on Friday.

title: What We Know About the Suspects in the Bondi Beach Shooting
summary: The police named Sajid Akram, 50, and his son, Naveed Akram, 24, as the suspects in the shooting that claimed 15 lives on Dec. 14.

title: Mitt Romney: Tax the Rich, Like Me
summary: There’s no getting around this if we want to avoid the deficit cliff ahead.

title: College Students Need Tech-Free Spaces
summary: Adults need to set up rules for students so that it’s not on them to self-regulate when it comes to going tech-free.

title: A Mysterious Death of a Teen Worker at a Nebraska Hog Farm
summary: A 17-year-old worker died at a pork producer in Nebraska run by the governor’s family. Two investigations later, the boy’s mother is still searching for answers.

title: Gaza City Famine Averted, Global Experts Say, but Palestinians Face Major Difficulties Accessing Food
summary: Food security experts said a famine reported in August had been alleviated but that the situation remained dire across the enclave, despite a cease-fire in October and greater flows of aid.

title: Lumbee Tribe in North Carolina Gains Federal Recognition After Generations-Long Fight
summary: The distinction for the Lumbee Tribe in North Carolina, signed into law on Thursday, opens access to federal support and defies challenges from other tribes over their legitimacy.

title: Want to Know Where the Market Is Going? Don’t Trust This, or Any, Forecast.
summary: Wall Street stock gurus are making predictions again. Our columnist got into the game with a number he doesn’t believe.
